title: We often get mad dealing with 'idiots', insulting or saying they'll never amount to anything, but are we too harsh? Would it be better if we were kind and patient with 'idiots' when they're not really trying to cause trouble? - Quora

response.answer_text: My.wife is African and speaks loads of different languages. Their words are much more socially nuanced than English. She has two words for 'villager'. Sort.of the same as 'idiot' or 'yokel'. One means someone who is an idiot because they don't know any better - an innocent idiot. The other means's someone who knows better but chooses to be an idiot - a malicious idiot. Obviously one of those deserves to be treated with kindness and educated. The other maybe isn't worth bothering with.

I’m ok with dumb. In fact I’ve been dumb more times than I can count. ‘Dumb’ with a side order of ‘loud’ tho, is different. I’m referring to the stuff you find on Facebook and Twitter - bombastic, bullying bullshit from people who are too dumb to know they’re dumb. patience, courtesy and respect are virtues not known to these people and it’s futile therefore putting it out there for them. by all means give it a go - kind and patient can do no wrong. But i figure that if my getting into a verbal stoush with one of these excites a flicker of intellectual fire in them then I’ve maybe done more good than ‘patient’ or ‘kind’ could. To your question then: yes*. (* excluding bombastic, bullying nobheads)
